body.p: The user can open a ticket :

ul.li:
in GLPI
via the interface to anonymously open tickets accessible by unauthenticated users
using the simplified (reduced entry form) for an authenticated user
via the standard interface (complete entry form)
Email: The user sends an email to an defined email address. Upon receipt of the email, a ticket is opened automatically (see ).

body.p: Whatever the creation method of a ticket, if no title (or subject to an email) is specified, the ticket will name as the first 70 characters of the description field (or the body of the email).
Depending on the configuration, some fields may be required to open a ticket (content, title and / or category). If one of them is missing the ticket will not be created.
body.note: The fields are described in the section .

Delegation allows a user to report an incident for another person. Configuring this feature is described in chapter . In the simplified interface, an option to specify whether the incident involved the user himself or another. In the standard interface, the option is active when the right See all tickets is disabled in the profile. This results in the addition as applicant of all users for whom the delegation takes place.

section.title: Interface for opening of anonymous tickets (for unauthenticated users)
section.p: Available at http://<GLPI_ADDRESS>/front/helpdesk.html, it allows users with no GLPI account to send a report form to the support center.
To do this, complete the entry form and validate (a message confirms the good creation of the ticket).
This form can be customized by editing the file directly helpdesk.html. By default the ticket is created in the root entity.

section.title: Simplified Interface
section.p: It allows an authenticated user to quickly create a ticket for himself or for another person (Delegation).
To do this, complete the entry form displayed upon GLPI login and validate.

li.p: Appears if followed by e-mail have been configured (see ).
Selection to "Yes" allows the requester to be informed by email of different updates for his ticket.

ul.li: Email : Address where notifications will be sent. If several are defined, it will take the default address associated with the authenticated user but it is possible to select another.

Hardware Type : Allows you to associate an inventory object to a ticket.
The content of the list depends on the settings in the profile (see ).

section.p: It is possible to add one or more documents in a single operation to the ticket.
A message confirms the creation of the ticket and can be accessed by clicking the ticket number that appears in green.

section.title: Standard Interface
section.p:
To create a new ticket go to the menu Assistance Tickets
.
It is possible to add one or more documents in a single operation to the ticket
A message confirms the creation of the ticket and can be accessed by clicking the ticket number that appears in green.
A request for validation can be performed at the opening of the ticket by simply indicating the desired validator.

body.note: At the entry of the requester or assigned technician, information is displayed to determine how many tickets the person has already opened or is currently supporting. Similar to the selection of equipment, a simplified view of current tickets is displayed.

section.title: Email Receiver
section.p: Just send an email to the address defined in the configuration (see ).
The subject line becomes the title of the ticket.
The message body will become the description of the ticket.
The attached documents to the e-mail will be added to the ticket.
